Summary: The 3 West Club is located across the street from Rockefeller Center and near St. Patrick's Cathedral. It is described as a "great little hotel" and a "best kept secret", with clean, comfortable rooms and a helpful staff, but without the amenities of a typical chain hotel.

The 414 Hotel is described as charming, intimate, contemporary, subtly hip, elegant, understated, and sophisticated, attracting many Europeans in addition to US and other international visitors. The hotel features striking photographic cityscapes, sumptuous white down comforters and natural fiber sheets, and guests breakfast together at a long, attractively stained table brightened by flowers.

60 Thompson is a stylish and modern hotel located in the heart of SoHo, with a chic lobby bar, a rooftop bar with nice views, and a restaurant that is a popular spot. The hotel has a hip vibe, and the staff are friendly and well-trained.

6 Columbus is a modern, boutique hotel with a sleek design, dark interiors, and a hip vibe, located across from the Time Warner Center and Columbus Circle subway station. The hotel features a Japanese/sushi restaurant and bar with a cool atmosphere, as well as small but well-designed rooms with platform beds and Fresh brand toiletries.

The 70 Park Avenue Hotel is a modern, trendy, and stylish boutique hotel with a zen-like atmosphere. It has iPod docking stations, plasma TVs, and a nightly happy hour, but the hallways are narrow and dark.

The Ace Hotel has a friendly hipster vibe with a lobby scene that is lively on weekend nights. The hotel has funky decor, an edgy but unpretentious atmosphere, and is popular with people in their 20s and 30s.

The hotel has a modern style, a "swanky" feel, and is often described as a "hidden gem" with a "boutique-y feel". The second floor lounge has been renovated and is a popular spot with fireplaces and big-screen TVs.

The Affinia Dumont is a modern hotel with spacious rooms, kitchenettes, and a gym, located in the Murray Hill neighborhood with close proximity to a variety of restaurants and a short walk to the subway. Some guests mention the hotel has great views of the Chrysler building and the East River.

The Affinia Gardens has modern, minimalist decor with a zen-like atmosphere, including a tea bar and options for meditation/yoga kits. It is located in the quieter Upper East Side, near Central Park and museums.

The hotel is near Madison Square Garden and offers a stylish bar, but it also has some rooms that are worn. Some reviewers felt the hotel had "character" or "art deco feel", others felt it looked old.

The Affinia Shelburne is a recently renovated, modern hotel with chic decor, a groovy bar atmosphere, and a rooftop bar offering great city views. Guests describe the hotel as chic, classy, and chic, with modern spacious rooms.

AKA United Nations offers modern, well-equipped apartments with kitchen facilities, modern decor, and complimentary breakfast. The hotel is conveniently located near Grand Central Terminus and the UN.

The Algonquin Hotel is known for its historic charm, literary connections, and unique atmosphere, particularly appealing to those seeking a non-chain experience. It features a New Yorker cartoon wallpaper, a resident cat, and a lobby bar that attracts a lively crowd.

The Americana Inn is a budget-friendly option in midtown Manhattan with small, basic rooms and shared bathrooms, and it is located near Times Square. Some reviewers mention a basic, European hostel-like, or institutional feel, and simple decor.

The Amsterdam Court Hotel has a modern lobby, restaurant, and bar with modern room designs; it is dimly lit with a snappy little lobby, and has a European ambiance. The hotel was described as "boutique" by some reviewers.

The Astor on the Park is a budget-friendly, basic hotel with small rooms and a location opposite Central Park; some reviewers describe it as similar to European hotels or an upmarket hostel, frequented mainly by European guests. The decor is not plush, but the hotel is clean and efficient, with friendly staff.

The Bedford Hotel is described as a "comfy-style boutique hotel" with a relaxed atmosphere and accommodating staff, located in mid-town Manhattan. Some reviewers mention an older, charming or European-style feel, while others note that the rooms are dated and in need of renovation.
The Beekman Tower has an Art Deco style and is reminiscent of a large, unfancy New York apartment. The restaurant on the 26th floor has terraces and beautiful views.

The Belleclaire is described as stylish, modern, sleek, classy, and hip with modern decor in the rooms; some rooms have iPod docks and flat-screen TVs. It is also described as having a European feel and design with hardwood floors.

The Bentley Hotel has a modern lobby, rooms with plasma TVs, and a rooftop bar with impressive city views, located in a quieter residential area near the East River and the 59th Street Bridge. Some found it stylish, with sleek, modern decor, while others noted it was dark or "faux chic" and in need of improvements.
The Best Western Bowery Hanbee is described as modern, sleek, and stylish, with laminate-wood floors and flat-panel TVs. Some reviewers mention its "boutique" feel and modern bathrooms.
I am sorry, I cannot answer this question based on the document.

The hotel is next door to the Hotel W and across the street from The Waldorf Astoria, with some reviewers recommending the bar at the W for a quick drink. The hotel has a contemporary feel, but is older and not modern, with basic B & W bathrooms.

The Seaport Inn is located in the South Street Seaport area, near the Brooklyn Bridge, with cobblestone streets and a variety of restaurants and cafes. It has a nice, cozy feel and old charm, with prints of historic etchings of the neighborhood in the rooms.

The Blue Moon Hotel is an artfully renovated tenement building with a vintage Americana flavor and rooms named after 1930s and 40s celebrities. It features original woodwork, mosaic tiling, colorful paintings, and unique decor, offering a distinctive and historic atmosphere.

Broadway Plaza Hotel is described as recently renovated, clean, and modern, with some rooms offering views of the Empire State Building. Some reviewers note the hotel's small entrance and lobby and the surrounding neighborhood being a wholesale district, not particularly glamorous.

The Buckingham Hotel has a hip lobby with lighting in the floor and designer furniture, with an art deco design and music-steeped decor. Some rooms have been renovated with fancy bathroom fixtures and are hip, modern, and updated.

The Candlewood Suites Times Square is a new hotel with modern amenities, including a full kitchen in each suite, flat-screen TVs, and free wireless internet; it is located a 5-10 minute walk from Times Square, close to restaurants and transportation. Some reviewers noted the rooms are small but well-equipped, and the hotel is sandwiched between a Holiday Inn Express and a Hampton Inn.

The Carlton Arms is an artsy, budget-friendly hotel with each room uniquely decorated by different New York artists, offering a funky and adventurous experience. It is centrally located near subways, restaurants, and bars, but expect some noise and minimal amenities.

The Carvi Hotel is a new boutique hotel that opened in 2009 and was previously a school once owned by Madonna. It features fresh, clean rooms with marble bathrooms, tiled double showers, and comfortable beds, though some rooms at the back have less desirable views and air conditioning noise.

The Casablanca Hotel is located just off Times Square and has a Moroccan theme, a 24/7 lounge for drinks and snacks, a library, and jazz piano on Friday evenings. The hotel has a distinct atmosphere and personality, making it different from a large hotel chain.

Chambers Hotel is a modern, stylish, and trendy boutique hotel with industrial-chic decor, art pieces, and minimalist rooms. It offers unique details like drawing paper with color pencils, industrial-style lighting, and Bumble & Bumble bath products.

Chelsea Lodge is a charming brownstone hotel with quirky, New England-style rooms and a cozy, home-like atmosphere. It is located in Chelsea, a safe and pleasant neighborhood close to subways, restaurants, and bars, making it easy to feel like a local.

Chelsea Pines Inn is a movie-themed small hotel with each room decorated with photos and posters of movie stars of the silver screen; it is also known for its friendly, helpful staff and convenient location near the subway. The rooms are quirky and unique and it features a meditation cat.

The Chelsea Savoy is described as a small, boutique-style hotel with a convenient location near subway lines and various shops and restaurants, and is located next to the famous Chelsea Hotel. Some reviewers noted the hotel's basic aesthetic.

City Club Hotel is a small, trendy boutique hotel with a chic and modern design, dark and masculine rooms, and a discreet entrance, aiming for a hip and private atmosphere. The hotel features design elements such as hidden TVs, cork floors, and marble bathrooms.

The Solita Soho is a modern, small boutique hotel with a stylish lobby featuring blue lights and chrome walls; rooms have plasma TVs and sleek decor. It is located at the intersection of Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho.

Club Quarters Downtown has a modern business aesthetic, with sleek, clean, and well-designed rooms featuring flat-screen TVs. Some rooms include iPod docks, and the hotel is near Wall Street and subway lines.

The hotel has a modern, Euro-sleek design, with updated rooms and a lounge that resembles a rich man's club, though some find it impersonal. Rooms include amenities such as flat-screen TVs, and there are free computers in the public areas.
Club Quarters Rockefeller Center has a modern, European design with clean, masculine rooms. The hotel has a crisp lobby and a 7th-floor terrace lounge with a peaceful atmosphere.
The hotel is next to Jay-Z's 40/40 club, and has an onsite bar; the hotel was renovated in 1912 with Victorian details in the bar. There are antique stores along the street.
This hotel has an old-fashioned charm due to the building's historical architecture, and the lobby is decorated with stained glass. The bar has a cosmopolitan vibe and is popular with non-guests.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan Bridge is a new and clean hotel located on the edge of Chinatown, near Little Italy and multiple subway lines. Rooms are modern, with flat-screen TVs, and the hotel offers free internet access.

The hotel is described as a modest but newly renovated, modern hotel with old-world classy decor downstairs and rooms that are comfortable and contemporary. The hotel features free internet and a fitness center.
The Comfort Inn Times Square West is a new hotel with modern decor, flat-screen TVs, and free high-speed Wi-Fi. It is located in the heart of the Theater District, right off Times Square.

This hotel receives mixed reviews, with some guests finding it clean and a good value, while others mention small rooms and a less-than-ideal location. Some reviewers mention that the rooms are newly renovated and modern.

The hotel is modern in style and decor, with rooms that feature a wall unit, closet, drawers, LCD TV, and marble and tile bath. Rooms are small, but well-equipped and comfortable with crisp, clean sheets and plump pillows.

The Cooper Square Hotel is a modern, stylish hotel with a library-themed lobby, dim lighting in the hallways and elevators, and rooms with floor-to-ceiling windows that offer city views. It is located downtown, close to the East Village, Bowery, and several subway lines.

The Cosmopolitan Hotel is described as quaint, clean, comfortable, and modern, and has been recently refurbished; it is located in the heart of Tri-BeCa, close to Greenwich Village. The hotel has a French cafe and a soda shop, and a subway stop is right outside.
The hotel has a modern style, with flat-screen TVs, and was recently renovated. Some reviewers noted the new bathrooms have sliding doors in a barn-door style.
The Courtyard Marriott Upper East Side has a modern, hip lobby with plasma TVs. The rooms are decorated with modern decor and are clean and new.
Some guests felt this location felt like a boutique hotel without the glitter. Rooms at this location have been renovated, are modern and well appointed, but small.
I'm sorry, but the reviews do not contain information about a hotel that feels effortlessly cool. The reviews focus on the hotel's location, cleanliness, and friendly service.

The Crosby Street Hotel is located in the heart of Soho and has a stylish design with tall warehouse-style windows, individually designed rooms, and oak-tree floors. The hotel also features a bar with over 400 bottles and attracts a wonderful crowd of guests.
The hotel has a lobby bar with a trendy atmosphere, and the reception area, bar, and restaurant are very chic. Newly redone, the rooms are modern, clean, and chic.

The Da Vinci hotel is described as a small European-style boutique hotel with character and a Euro atmosphere; it has a cozy lobby with a gas fireplace. The hotel is located near a bar and Joe G's Italian restaurant, which has a good atmosphere.

The Doubletree Guest Suites in Times Square is described as not being as hip or trendy as the W across the street, but offers spacious suites with recent renovations. The public areas, including the elevators, appear to be newly renovated.

The Doubletree Chelsea is a new, modern hotel with clean rooms and beech furniture, located in a transitioning area near wholesale shops, a short walk to Penn Station and Chelsea galleries. Some reviewers mentioned its modern design and that it has a newer feel.

This hotel has a lobby and bar with contemporary design and a bustling atmosphere, with flat-screen TVs and mini-bars in each room. The hotel is within walking distance of a Whiskey Blue bar and has access to the Whiskey Blue through its lobby.

The Dream Hotel is a trendy and modern hotel with a hip atmosphere, rooftop bar, blue neon lights and eclectic decor. It is located in the heart of Manhattan, close to Times Square and Central Park, and is suitable for younger crowds.

The Duane Street Hotel is a new, modern, and stylish boutique hotel in the Tribeca area, decorated in a Euro-modern style with hardwood floors and maple wood built-in pieces. It is located in a mixed neighborhood that is safe and fairly lively.

The Dylan Hotel aims for a stylish and modern aesthetic with design-conscious details, like chemistry beakers as drinking glasses, but some guests found it falling short of a truly "hip" or boutique experience. Some rooms have unique layouts with high ceilings, while the lobby features a chic and well-appointed design.

The Eastgate Tower is a basic hotel with outdated decor, though some rooms have been renovated; it is located in Midtown Manhattan near Grand Central Station. The W hotel is a minute's walk away for those seeking a hip crowd.

There is no mention of a cool or effortlessly cool atmosphere at this Econo Lodge. Reviews focus on the small, clean rooms, great location near Times Square, and friendly staff, with complimentary breakfast.

The hotel is described as modern, with chic decor, contemporary art, and a hip design; it is situated in a construction zone and very unfinished. Reviews mention a buzzing lively friendly atmosphere at cocktail time, with recent refurbishments and a more quiet, less congested area of the city.

The Empire Hotel has a trendy and hip vibe, with a stylish lobby, a rooftop bar, and a separate rooftop lounge open to the public and is frequented by younger crowds. The hotel has been newly renovated and is designed in a modern, boutique style.

The Envoy Club offers spacious apartment-style accommodations with fully equipped kitchens, with some rooms recently refurbished. It has a rooftop deck with city views, and is located within walking distance of attractions like the Empire State Building.

The Eurostars Wall Street is described as a "cool hotel" with a "stylish and boutique feel," modern rooms and furniture, and tastefully appointed decor. The ambiance is likened to that of a boutique hotel, and the lounge sometimes plays rap music.

The Excelsior Hotel has a jazzy bar/restaurant and a marble-floored mahogany lobby which contributes to an elegant mid-class atmosphere, but some found the front desk staff rude. Some found the hotel rooms beautifully detailed, clean, and nice.

The Fairfield Inn is a new, modern hotel with flat-screen TVs, uniquely decorated breakfast room, and clean rooms. The decor was mode with warm burgundy and beige colors, and bathrooms have glass shower doors.

The Fitzpatrick Grand Central is not a glitzy hotel, with a small lobby and a country inn ambiance; some found it to be an average hotel comparable to a Sheraton Four Points. Reviewers noted that BA flight crews often stay at the hotel and some reviewers felt like they were staying in an airport hotel rather than a cool city destination.

The Fitzpatrick Manhattan is described as not being modern or stylish, but rather adequate and bland, with some reviewers noting the decor is outdated and the bar lacking atmosphere. Others note refurbished rooms are compact but well appointed with contemporary furnishings.
The Flatotel has a modern, cosmopolitan decor, with sleek and minimalist design elements. Some reviewers have described the lobby as trendy, while others found it dark and depressing.
The Four Points Sheraton Manhattan Chelsea has a "hip" lobby that plays music and a trendy bar. The hotel rooms feature modern décor.

The hotel has new rooms with an industrial urban feel and a modern style, and it is located on the edge of Soho. It is described as trendy and boutique-like, with wood and steel accents, and has a small bar with an outdoor seating area.
The hotel has a nice decor with a minimalist approach to decorating and well-appointed rooms with a cool flatscreen tv on the wall. The hotel is new and has a modern, boutique style.

The hotel's lobby is considered spectacular and grand, and the bar is known to be quite happening with business types; the hotel has a buzz of an important place with investment bankers and lawyers more prevalent than lobbyists. Guests have also noted the hotel has a modern, I.M. Pei design.

Gild Hall is a boutique hotel with a funky, modern design, often described as a mix of old-boy British club and zen simplicity, or a "hipster hunting lodge" with leather and dark wood accents. The hotel features quirky decor like rhino footrests and antler chandeliers, with rooms offering comfortable beds, high-quality linens, and amenities such as iPod docking stations and flat-screen TVs.

The Gramercy Park Hotel is a hip boutique hotel with trendy decor and a "happening" bar scene, especially at the Rose Bar, and exclusive access to the rooftop lounge. Some reviewers describe the public spaces as swank, the art collection as great, and the overall atmosphere as bohemian.
The Grand Hyatt has a water fountain, traditional decor, dark lighting, and piano, with a lobby that is reminiscent of an airport lounge or shopping arcade. There is also a fitness center.

The Greenwich Hotel, owned by Robert De Niro, is located in TriBeCa and has a European feel with eclectic decor, a lobby with comfortable chairs and a wood-burning fireplace, and a courtyard. It features a Japanese-style pool, drawing room, and the Italian restaurant Locanda Verde.
The Hampton Inn has modern, clean rooms with flat-screen TVs, iPod docks, and comfortable beds. It is a new hotel that feels more like a Hilton Garden Inn.
The Hampton Inn Madison Square Garden features modern, sleek rooms with flat-screen TVs, offering a contemporary feel. Some reviewers noted a minimalist chic lobby.
The Hampton Inn Chelsea has modern decor and is near Chelsea, Greenwich Village, and the Flatiron district. Some rooms offer views of the NYC skyline.

The Hampton Inn Soho features exposed beams in the lobby, silver accents, and art, with a greenhouse that has a buddha head. The hotel's decor offers a trendy, industrial chic feel, with pleasant guestrooms and city artwork in the corridors.
The hotel is described as small, clean and modern with up-to-date bathrooms, and a high-definition LG flatscreen TV in the rooms. It is a narrow, tall building with only 6 rooms per floor.

The Hampton Inn Seaport has deep-blue walls giving it a boutique look, and is in a historic building strategically situated to accommodate only 8 rooms per floor. Some rooms have terraces with views of the Brooklyn Bridge and the Seaport.

The Helmsley Middletowne is an older hotel with large rooms, some renovated, and suites with kitchenettes, but no coffee maker. It has a very small lobby, offers a basic continental breakfast, and is centrally located near Times Square and Grand Central Station.

The Hilton Club is a hotel-within-a-hotel on the 37th and 38th floors with its own private check-in and dedicated elevators. It features small, ship-like rooms with built-in furnishings and glass-walled showers with rainfall heads and side jets.

The Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea is described as a small boutique hotel in the Flower District with a modern style and clean, well-decorated rooms, and a lobby that is like an oasis. The hotel has a generally positive reputation for its newness and cleanliness.
The Hilton Garden Inn is described as clean and modern with a contemporary decor, HD flat screen TVs, and Bliss bath products. It has a small bar and a stylish bathroom with glass showers.

The Hilton Garden Inn Times Square features updated and modern rooms, black & white photos of NYC, and a rooftop Skybar lounge. It is located in Hell's Kitchen on 8th Avenue, within walking distance of a vibrant theatre district and jazz clubs.
The hotel is located in the Tribeca/Soho area, close to many restaurants and shops, with subway access right outside. The hotel has a contemporary feel, clean rooms, and comfortable beds.

The Hilton New York has a lobby bar with a good atmosphere and quick waiter service. Some reviewers describe the rooms as having an 'eighties vibe' or being 'modern', with sleek, built-in furniture and LCD-screen TVs.

The Hilton Times Square offers modern, clean rooms with amenities, a boutique feel, and a bar; some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building. The lobby has a modern design and intimate bar, and the hotel's entrance is inconspicuous.

The hotel has a small, modern design, and is in a great location close to attractions; it is clean and updated with LCD TVs and free Wi-Fi. Rooms are small and efficient, with some offering views of office blocks.
The Holiday Inn Express Times Square South is a new or recently renovated hotel with modern, clean rooms. It is located a few blocks from Times Square.

The Holiday Inn Express Madison Square Garden is a new or recently renovated hotel with modern decor and upscale furnishings. Rooms are compact, but clean, and located in the Chelsea/Garment District area near Penn Station and Times Square.

The hotel is located on the border of Chinatown and Soho, near subway stations and a short walk from Little Italy. Some reviewers found the hotel to be relatively basic, while others found it to be more interesting than staying in the touristy Midtown area.
This Holiday Inn is a basic, older hotel with some style issues, such as dated decor and drab hallways, that some guests found depressing. There is a pool on the 14th floor with views of the city.
The hotel is new and modern, with a sleek design. It is located in the Chelsea/Garment district near the Fashion Museum/College and has a trendy bar called Rogue nearby.

Hotel 17 is a budget-friendly, European-style hotel in a central location with quirky decor, and a quiet atmosphere; it's known for being a filming location for Woody Allen's "Manhattan Murder Mystery" and for previously hosting Madonna. Rooms are small and some have shared bathrooms.
Hotel 31 is a budget hotel with a retro feel, old-fashioned elevators, high ceilings and wood mouldings, but is clean and safe. The hotel has a film noir style look which some guests liked very much.

Hotel 373 is a modern and trendy boutique hotel with clean rooms and a convenient location near attractions like the Empire State Building. The hotel has an Ipod docking station, Starbucks, and a modern design.

Hotel 41 is a trendy, small boutique hotel with a happening bar that is popular with non-residents, some of whom are associated with the Nederlander Theatre next door. The whole place, from the decor to the staff, has a really nice vibe to it and the hotel resembles entering a night club with retro dance music resonating from the bar.

Hotel 99 has modern, well-decorated rooms with large LCD TVs and bathrooms with glass door showers and bathtubs. It is located in the Upper West Side, close to the metro, but was undergoing renovations in 2009.
The Beacon Hotel features renovated rooms with boutique flavor and pleasant decor. Some rooms have views of the Ansonia Building, Central Park, or the Hudson River.

Hotel Chandler is a modern, recently renovated boutique hotel with spotlessly clean rooms, Aveda toiletries, flatscreen TVs, and iPod docks, and a location near the Empire State Building. Some reviewers mention the hotel has a sophisticated feel, is decorated in a trendy contemporary style, and has a cozy little bar.
Hotel Deauville is a European-style hotel with an old-world feel, featuring purple bathrooms and a manual elevator operated by staff. Some rooms have views of brick walls and older bathroom fixtures.

The East Houston Hotel is a small, modern boutique hotel with an Asian minimalist decor, cherry wood floors, and a rooftop lounge with city views. It is located in the Lower East Side, close to Soho, Little Italy, and the subway.

Hotel Elysee is a small, elegant, European-style boutique hotel with vintage decor and vintage wall paintings in the Monkey Bar; its ambiance is elegant, sophisticated and subdued. The hotel clientele is typically older.

This trendy hotel is located in the Meatpacking District, known for nightlife, restaurants, shops, and a "see-and-be-seen" atmosphere. It features a rooftop bar and pool, which are popular with locals, and rooms have a modern, minimalist decor.

Hotel Giraffe is a modern, new hotel with a European style, art deco lobby, and rooms with high ceilings, high-tech amenities and good storage. The hotel has a rooftop bar, is decorated with plants, hosts wine and cheese in the lobby, has elegant decor, a comfortable lobby with newspapers, and is near Gramercy Park.

Hotel rooms are small with dated decor, but clean, with marble bathrooms in some rooms, and the lobby has been newly renovated; some reviewers found the hotel depressing. The Grand Union is located in Korea Town, close to the Empire State Building, and subway lines.

Hotel Indigo has a modern minimalist design with interior design that is modern but not over the top, as well as bar and restaurant that are attractive and kind of cool. However, some found it nondescript and minimal but not really from a designed point of view.

Hotel Mela is a modern, stylish boutique hotel with sleek decor and a crimson lobby, located a block from Times Square. The rooms feature flat-screen LCD TVs, H2O bath amenities, and iPod-compatible alarm clocks.

The Hotel Metro has an art deco theme, and a rooftop bar with views of the Empire State Building. Reviews mention that the hotel has a 1930's design, is clean, has a good location, and has a rooftop terrace.

Hotel Newton is a basic, clean hotel near the subway with no bar or restaurant, but there are plenty of dining options nearby. Some reviewers compare it to non-chain European hotels, with remodeled rooms, spiffy kitchen areas, and efficient staff.

The Hotel on Rivington is a trendy, modern, sleek hotel in the Lower East Side with a sexy vibe, floor-to-ceiling windows, and a popular bar/restaurant. It features minimalist decor, dark hallways, plasma TVs, and attracts a young, stylish crowd.

Hotel Reserve is described as modern, new, well-designed, and nicely updated, with Ikea-style furniture, a big flat-screen TV, and upscale bathroom amenities. Some found the hotel "hip", but others reported it was not very hip.

The St. James Hotel is an older, basic hotel that is undergoing renovations, with some rooms being newly remodeled. It is located a block from Times Square, is close to the subway, and has some friendly staff.

The Hotel Stanford has a lobby with a 20s art deco feel, and a small bar that specializes in jazz and karaoke, which seems to have a few regular musicians that pop in. The hotel is located in Koreatown and the karaoke bar has a friendly atmosphere.

The Hotel Wales has a distinctive style, is furnished in a simple yet comfortable style, and has dark wood paneling that makes it an interesting place to stay in NYC. Some found the hotel charming, European, and funky.

The Hudson Hotel is a trendy and modern hotel, designed by Phillip Stark, that features exposed brick, exposed ivy, glass, and dark wood, creating a cool lobby, a library bar, an indoor bar with a painted ceiling, and an outdoor bar. The hotel has multiple bars, including a rooftop bar with views.
Ink48 is a hip, stylish, and funky boutique hotel with modern and simple rooms. The hotel has a lounge-like lobby and unique design elements such as a wall of shoeshine bristles in the elevators.

Inn New York City is located in a classic townhouse on a quiet street on the Upper West Side with uniquely decorated suites and a quirky atmosphere. There is no hotel sign and it looks and acts like a polished private residence.
The hotel has an old-fashioned ambience and style and a beautiful lobby. The rooms are clean, and it has an olf-fashioned ambience and style.
The hotel has a trendy lobby, bar, and restaurant featuring art deco ambiance. Rooms include modern updates such as mood lighting controlled by a touch screen, and ipod docking stations.

The Kitano has a Japanese theme, with a jazz lounge that closes early and live music in the bar; it is frequented by Japanese business people and staff. Some found the hotel stiff, others found it an oasis of calm, with Botero art in the lobby and decor in calming colors.

The hotel features a rooftop bar with views of the Empire State Building and is located in Koreatown with Korean restaurants and karaoke. Some reviewers mention the hotel is old, grungy, or tired and in need of renovation.

Lafayette House is a quirky boutique hotel in the East Village, decorated in an eccentric, arty style reminiscent of the 1940s with antique furniture. It offers large, suite-sized rooms, some with fireplaces, kitchenettes, and access to a courtyard garden.

Le Parker Meridien has a modern and Bauhaus-style interior design, with cartoons playing in the elevators. The hotel includes a popular burger joint hidden in the lobby and coffee made from “counter-culture beans”.

The Library Hotel is a trendy, chic boutique hotel with a unique literary theme, rooftop bar, and unique cozy rooms. It has a lively bar with a sleek, mod feel and an "oasis of calm" compared to the city's hustle.
The hotel has a lively lobby and is frequented by celebrities. It has a Library bar that is a nice place to hang out.

The Lowell is an intimate, luxurious hotel on the Upper East Side, located off Madison Avenue, with renovated suites that feel like apartments, including kitchenettes and marble bathrooms. The hotel is described as a quiet and elegant spot, appealing to those seeking a luxurious home away from home.
The Mandarin Oriental NYC has a modern look and feel, with an Asian influence throughout. Some reviewers describe the hotel as "zen" with a sophisticated minimalist approach.

The Milford Plaza is described as an older hotel with 1920s character and a quirky feel; the lobby and renovated club rooms are highlights. It is near Broadway, has a fast elevator system and is undergoing renovations.

The Millenium Hilton has clean rooms, a sleek and modern style, and was renovated after 9/11, which guests have described as a hip refuge from the NYC commotion. Some rooms have large plasma TVs and city views, and is located near subway for easy access around Manhattan.

The Millennium Broadway has a lobby with dark marble and an art deco design, with spacious rooms that feature bright, tasteful decor and skyline views. The hotel's location off Times Square is near lively attractions and it has friendly staff to assist with guest needs.
The hotel is modern, clean, and minimalistic, with a chic lobby, and views of the New York skyline. Rooms are well-sized, have large LCD TVs, and some even have kitchenettes.
The Moderne Hotel has a retro style, funky decor, and an Andy Warhol theme with Marilyn Monroe pictures. Rooms are described as modern, minimalistic, clean, and classy with a contemporary feel.

Morgans is a modern, stylish hotel with a black and white theme throughout, designed to feel like an upscale residence, with modern art and a lobby that features a moving checkerboard display on the ceiling. Some reviewers describe the hotel as "chic and sexy" with a cool and comfortable atmosphere.

The hotel is described as clean, quiet, and comfortable, with spacious rooms that include a kitchenette. Some reviewers note the decor is dated, with furnishings from the 70s or 80s, while others found it homey.

I am sorry, but based on the reviews, it is difficult to ascertain whether the hotel feels effortlessly cool, as the reviews mainly focus on it being a budget hotel. However, some reviews do indicate it has European-style or "shabby-chic" decor.

The hotel has a bar with a cool vibe, but it is 100% tourists, and the rooms are recently renovated with flat-screen TVs and iHome clock/radios for iPods. The hotel restaurant offers a nice bar-like atmosphere that is a bit pricey.

The hotel is located across from the W hotel, and some reviewers mention the hotel bar is not a trendy or hip place. However, reviewers also state the W and Intercontinental (Barclay) are nearby and offer excellent bar scenes for the 50's types.

The Marriott Marquis is a large, modern hotel with bars, lounges, and restaurants, featuring a glass elevator system and a revolving restaurant with city views. It's located in Times Square, close to Broadway shows, but some found it impersonal due to its size.

The Gilt bar is decorated to a very high standard and is very comfortable, decorated to a very high standard, and cool, and the GILT bar has a trendy setting. The New York Palace is known for filming the popular CW television show "Gossip Girl".

The Night Hotel has a modern gothic style and a black and white color scheme, with design details such as music playing in the hallways, LCD monitors of fish outside rooms, and personalized cards. The rooms have Bose sound systems and flat screen TVs, but some guests found the hotel too dark or rooms too small and that there were noise issues.
The Novotel Times Square has a chic lobby with outdoor terrace and views; some rooms are modern and others are dated. It attracts an international clientele, including Air France crews.

Off Soho Suites is located in Lower Manhattan, within walking distance of Soho, Greenwich Village, Little Italy, and Chinatown. The hotel has received testimonials from Henry Rollins, Slash's Snakepit and other musicians.
The Omni Berkshire Place has a stylish lobby bar, comfortable rooms, and a sun deck. The hotel has an older, more traditional decor with marble, brass, and old-fashioned ceiling cornices.

On the Ave is a modern, boutique hotel with stylish, clean rooms, and sleek, minimalist decor, located in the Upper West Side, offering a very urban boutique feel. Some rooms have terraces with panoramic views, and the hotel has a 16th-floor roof terrace.

The Park 79 Hotel has an old-world charm with hardwood floors and moldings, but some find it shabby and not as modern as the website suggests. Some rooms have been renovated with new bathrooms and flat-screen TVs, but others are small and have thin walls.
The Park Central Hotel has a trendy lobby and bar, is described as a modern posh hotel, and has rooms with wide-screen TVs. The lobby remodel is described as "cutting edge" and "with it."

The Park South Hotel has a bar/restaurant, The Black Duck, with a log fire, jazz music, and a happening atmosphere. It has an art deco style and aims for a simple, apartment-like aesthetic rather than a tacky hotel vibe.

The Peninsula New York is described as elegant without being glitzy, renovated with quietly sexy rooms, and decorated with dark wood and olive green carpeting. The rooftop lounge has a trendy outdoor area and amazing views of the city.

The Phillips Club offers stylish, modern rooms/suites with great flat-screens, Bose sound systems, attractive lighting, and nice kitchens and bathrooms. Its lobby is stunning, and it attracts a mix of guests, including New Yorkers between homes and movie/TV stars.

The Plaza Athenee is an intimate, European-style hotel located on a quiet, tree-lined street on the Upper East Side, near Central Park and Madison Avenue. Some found the decor not modern but tasteful and rooms elegantly appointed with French furniture.

The Radisson Martinique on Broadway is described as an older, but clean, hotel with a central location close to shopping, transportation, and attractions; recent updates and modern bathrooms are mentioned in some reviews, while others cite a need for renovation. The hotel caters to flight crews and tour groups and has a small lobby that can get crowded.

The hotel has a bright, clean, and new vibe but is located in an older New York building with a location in the quieter Murray Hill neighborhood near some Italian and Indian restaurants. Rooms have been renovated with contemporary designs in sage green, dark brown, and oatmeal colors with Tempur-pedic mattresses, flat screen TVs, and coffee makers.

The Red Roof Inn Manhattan offers nice, new, and modern rooms with amenities like flat-screen TVs and iPod docks, with some rooms even offering views of the Empire State Building. It also has a bar/lounge that is described as cozy and cool for a reviving drink.
Hotel 57, now the Renaissance 57, is a sleek, modern boutique hotel with a European feel and a hip, trendy vibe. The decor is minimalistic but modern and edgy, with warm lighting and artistic glass.

The Renaissance Times Square is a modern/futuristic hotel with X-like decor, copper wall coverings, and unique lobby furnishings. Rooms are decorated in a contemporary style and feature spacious layouts, comfy beds, and great showers.

The Residence Inn Times Square has modern, clean rooms with amenities like a kitchenette and comfortable beds, and a cozy 3rd-floor lounge. The hotel is located in midtown Manhattan, close to Times Square and Bryant Park.

The hotel has a modern, art-deco lobby, a cool rooftop bar with panoramic views and an outdoor terrace, and is located in a quiet area removed from the hustle and bustle of midtown. The hotel is frequented by a younger, professional clientele.
The Rockefeller Center Hotel features modern decor, self-service check-in kiosks, and a small lobby, with a lounge on the second floor. Rooms have a gray and maroon color scheme.
The Roger Smith Hotel is a boutique hotel with unique decor in each room, an artsy feel, and an art gallery. It is also known for its hip bar/restaurant, Lily's.

The Roger Williams Hotel is a trendy, modern, and stylish boutique hotel with a hidden gem-like lobby and trendy bar, and a location that is far enough from the craziness of Times Square. The hotel has chic and eclectic touches, and the staff is friendly and helpful.

Room Mate Grace is a trendy, European-style boutique hotel that has a swimming pool/bar/sauna area and hip clientele, with a funky, IKEA-like showroom aesthetic. The hotel has narrow rooms that make good use of space and an eclectic vibe.
The Royalton is a hip and trendy boutique hotel with a stylish bar and a lobby that has a funky fireplace. The hotel has a moody, dark, and elegant feel with a minimalist style.

The Salisbury Hotel has an "old charm" with some reviewers noting the decor is "dated", but adds to the character of the hotel and it has "character" unlike more modern hotels. It is also across from Carnegie Hall & the Russian tea rooms.

The San Carlos has been renovated with modern furnishings and a sleek design, and some reviewers describe it as hip, trendy, and sophisticated. This boutique hotel also offers amenities such as Aveda bath products, flatscreen TVs, and a business center with free internet.
I'm sorry, but the reviews focus on the hotel being a budget accommodation with a great location and do not contain information about the hotel having a cool atmosphere.

The hotel lobby has been recently remodeled with a contemporary internet lounge/bar/coffee and seating area; the rooms have not been updated. The hotel is described as a basic business hotel with a busy lobby; the location is convenient to midtown.

The Skyline Hotel has an art deco style lobby and is near many good restaurants on 9th Ave. Some reviewers noted the bar was dark and dismal and the staff was stand-offish, while others described the hotel as clean, comfortable, a great value and a great location.

The Smyth Tribeca is a new, modern boutique hotel with stylish decor designed by Yabu Pushelberg, Helmut Lang uniforms, and a trendy lobby with cozy nooks. Rooms feature dark wood, marble bathrooms, and modern amenities.

The Sofitel New York has a lobby with candlelit, marble flooring, and European-styled furniture that gives off an elegant, sophisticated feel, with staff greeting guests in French. The hotel has a gym, bar, and rooms feature a Bose radio and comfortable beds.

The Soho Grand Hotel is a hip, trendy, and stylishly decorated hotel with a cool lobby and bar scene, a casual vibe, and a gold fish as a companion; known for its excellent location in the SoHo area. However, some reviewers felt it was past its prime, grubby, and overpriced for what it offers.

Soho House New York is located in the trendy Meatpacking District and features stunning decor, spacious rooms with vintage furniture, and a rooftop pool and bar. It is a private club, so it has a hip vibe and attracts a young crowd.

Stay Hotel has a trendy and chic lobby with aquariums and funky lighting and a modern bar that has a lodge-like theme with a lighted mosaic wall. Some found it hip and well-designed, with a cool lounge called Aspen Social Club.

The Alex Hotel is described as modern, trendy, and minimalist, featuring stylish rooms with flat-screen TVs and Frederic Fekkai toiletries. The hotel has a small, hip bar area and is located in Midtown Manhattan near Grand Central Station.

The Belvedere Hotel has an art deco style lobby, is located in the heart of the Theater District, and is within walking distance of Times Square. Executive rooms are newly renovated with marble bathrooms and flat screen TVs.

The Benjamin is a smaller boutique hotel with a Beaux Arts style lobby, offering rooms with amenities such as a pillow menu, kitchenettes, and sound systems. Some found it overrated and worn while others praised its service and convenient Midtown location.

The Blakely Hotel is a small boutique hotel with an old-world feel and a Men's Lounge or Country Club-like atmosphere, featuring dark wood and spacious, clean rooms. Some found it to be dark or in need of updating, but overall the Blakely provides a calm, quiet, and sophisticated setting.

The Bowery Hotel is described as a trendy hotel with a hip vibe, frequented by locals and those "in the know," with a stylish bar and lounge area. The hotel has a bohemian hideaway vibe, with decor that is described as having an old English or vintage feel.

The Bryant Park Hotel is a trendy and modern hotel with a "hip vibe", with a red-lit lobby and Cellar Bar and attracts a young, hip clientele. It is also known for being a fashion/celeb hotspot and being located across the street from Bryant Park.

The Carlton on Madison is a stylish hotel with a grand lobby, frequented by a young and hip clientele, and features a popular bar with a trendy atmosphere. Some reviewers note the hotel's elegant, modern design, and clubby atmosphere.

The Carlyle has a classic, old-school New York atmosphere with art deco design, Kiehl's toiletries, and live jazz; Bemelmans Bar is a popular spot with Madeline-themed decor. It attracts celebrities and offers personalized service.
The Franklin Hotel is a small, European-style boutique hotel with chandeliers, modern decor, and Bulgari toiletries. It is located on the Upper East Side, near the subway and museums.

The French Quarters Guest Apartments has a New Orleans-inspired decor, a hopping adjacent pub, and a warm, welcoming feel. The rooms are well-appointed, chic, and beautifully decorated, with comfortable beds and large showers.
The Gem Hotel Chelsea is a modern, "boutique-y/NYC feel" hotel with European-style rooms, spotlighted orchids, and local art. It is located in the heart of Chelsea.

The Gem Hotel has a "Zen minimalism" style with modern, recently updated rooms that include stylish decor, flat-screen TVs, and iPod docks. It is described as a "Boutique Hotel" that is stylish, bare bones, and minimal.

The Gem Soho is a small boutique hotel in a trendy area close to clubs, restaurants, and shopping, with stylish but compact rooms. Some reviewers have compared the ambiance to a W hotel combined with the feel of a B&B.

The Grant Hotel is a budget-friendly option near the subway with clean rooms and shared bathrooms; some rooms have been updated with modern furnishings and TVs, while others may have older carpets or face brick walls. Some reviewers noted the presence of friendly staff and a European clientele.

The Hampton Inn has been recently renovated, with a stylish lobby, modern rooms, and a High Bar cocktail bar on the roof. The hotel is located a block from Times Square and offers free coffee and tea all day.

The Helmsley Carlton House is located on the upper east side of Manhattan, one block from Central Park, with spacious rooms, some of which have kitchenettes and sitting areas. It has elevator operators and no common lobby space.
This hotel has an old-fashioned glamour with mirrored ceilings and vintage decor, but some find it dated, worn, and tacky. Select rooms have flat-screen TVs.

The hotel is located in a historic building, the former Life Magazine building, with art gallery-like walls and a vintage aesthetic. Some rooms are renovated with modern furniture, large bathrooms, chandeliers, period hardware, and reproductions from Life Magazine.
Hotel 91 is described as modern, minimalist, and clean, with a "fresh" feel and new-looking rooms. It is located in the heart of Chinatown, which some reviewers found to be a good experience.

I'm sorry, but this hotel appears to be more functional than effortlessly cool. Many reviewers mention that it is a great value and in a good location, but other comments imply that it is more of a budget hotel that met basic needs.

The Inn at Irving Place is located in two combined brownstones with antique furnishings and decor reminiscent of the 19th century. The hotel is associated with Cibar, a martini bar with an outdoor patio, and Lady Mendl's Tea Salon, which hosts events like bridal showers.

The Iroquois is a classy, calm, and beautifully decorated boutique hotel with cozy common areas and friendly staff, appealing to those who appreciate a small, European-style ambiance. The hotel offers modern amenities and is within walking distance to Times Square and other attractions, while still being located on a quiet, tree-lined street.
The Jane Hotel has a "funky, eclectic, dishevelled in a good way decor," and a cool bar that attracts a huge line every night. It is located in a great area for plenty of pubs/bars/restaurants.

The Kimberly Hotel is described as a boutique hotel with a small lobby, and rooms with antique-replica style furniture. Some reviewers found the hotel to be dated in decor, while others found it to be clean and comfortable.

The Lombardy is a small boutique hotel on 56th St with individually owned studio or one-bedroom apartments, each decorated differently under central hotel management, offering a unique theme in each room. It is centrally located near restaurants, shops, and the subway.

The London NYC is a modern and hip hotel with sleek decor, a lively bar, and a younger crowd, though some find it lacking the exclusivity of other hotels. Some reviewers mentioned seeing celebrities and the cast of Gossip Girl at the hotel.

The Lucerne is traditionally decorated, and has attracted Columbia University students on the weekends, with some lively bars nearby; one reviewer also felt it had a european vibe. The Upper West Side location is away from the BLING of Times Square.

The Manhattan Club offers a 26th-floor lounge with newspapers, and free coffee, tea, and biscuits from 11 am-4 pm. Some reviewers mention a great bartender in the club bar and the availability of an owner's lounge.

The Mansfield Hotel is a small, stylish boutique hotel with a library-style bar and a reading room with a fireplace. Some reviewers describe the hotel as having an old-world charm, and a sophisticated, literary vibe.

The Marcel at Gramercy is a modern and trendy boutique hotel with funky decor, a hip lobby, and avante garde rooms, sometimes decorated with zebra print. The hotel has a rooftop terrace and lounge on the 10th floor.

The Maritime Hotel has a hip, retro look with a nautical theme throughout, including small, ship cabin-like rooms with porthole windows. It features a lively bar and restaurant scene, particularly on weekends, attracting a hip media crowd.

The Mark is located on the Upper East Side, close to museums, art galleries, Central Park, and upscale shopping. After a renovation, rooms feature modern design, remote-controlled shades, LCD TVs, Blu Ray DVD players, and marble bathrooms with TV mirrors.

The Marmara Manhattan is located on the Upper East Side in a residential area, with apartment-style rooms that include full kitchens and modern decor. The hotel is near grocery stores, restaurants, and is a short subway ride away from attractions.
The hotel has a modern style and chic decor with vibrant colors, red accents, and balloons in the lobby. It is located in a vibrant area, and is described as funky, stylish, and trendy.

The Mercer is a trendy, understated boutique hotel with a chic, minimalist design, located in the heart of SoHo near shopping, restaurants, and subway connections. The hotel has a hip and edgy lobby with a library and bar/restaurant open only to hotel guests, creating a relaxed, exclusive atmosphere.

The Michelangelo Hotel offers a smaller, more welcoming atmosphere than mega-chains, with a beautiful lobby, piano music, and a calm atmosphere. It is located within walking distance to Times Square, 5th avenue, Central Park, and Rockefeller Center.
The Milburn is not a luxury hotel and has an older, basic style. Reviews mention that the hotel has been renovated but the decor can be outdated.
The Muse Hotel is a trendy, modern, and stylish hotel with art deco themed rooms, renovated lobby, and a glamorous bar. The hotel offers a nightly wine reception, and iPod docks in the rooms.

The New York Helmsley has a swanky, dimly lit lobby with antique furniture and is located near the Chrysler Building and Grand Central station. It is an older hotel with decor from the 1970s and 1980s and has a small bar.

The New Yorker Hotel has Art Deco styling, and some rooms have Empire State Building views; some reviewers described it as beautiful, charming, and a gem. The lobby has a bustling atmosphere and a mix of modern and historical elements.

The Pierre is a luxurious, classic hotel located across from Central Park and known for its old-world charm, elevator operators, and recent renovations that blend classic architecture with modern amenities, including a lobby lounge with a cocktail menu. The hotel features elegant rooms with high-quality furniture, marble bathrooms, and updated features, though some guests have noted issues with noise from air conditioning units and ongoing construction.
The hotel's Rose Club appears to attract a younger clientele and the rooms have novel technology. The location is central, near Central Park, shopping, and theaters.

The Pod Hotel has funky, trendy decor with a stylish lobby and rooftop chill-out space; the rooms include an iPod docking station, and there's music played in the hallways and bathrooms. Reviewers describe the hotel's clientele as younger and hip.

The Premier is described as a boutique hotel with modern, serene, and comfortable rooms, located within the Millennium Broadway hotel. It offers amenities such as a complimentary breakfast, evening drinks, and a mezzanine lounge.

The Ritz Carlton Central Park has a sophisticated lobby and attracts an elegantly dressed crowd. Its bar has an understated elegance that some reviewers describe as having the atmosphere of a private club.

The Roosevelt Hotel has a grand lobby with a lively bar that attracts Madison Avenue types, and a rooftop bar with panoramic views; however, some found the rooms to be outdated and small, while others describe the hotel as charming old world New York.

The Sherry-Netherland is a small, luxurious hotel with individually owned and decorated rooms that feel like opulent apartments. It's known for its discreet service, Central Park location, and unique touches like hand-painted elevators and fresh flowers.

The Shoreham is a modern, trendy, and hip boutique hotel with a sleek bar, minimalist decor, and a funky mood that some guests find stylish. Some reviewers noted that the hotel caters to a younger, hip crowd.

The St. Regis has a classic and traditional style, with opulent Victorian decor, antique French furniture, and gilded age ambiance. Some guests found it to be a "grand dame" hotel with "old world charm" and an elegant, hushed atmosphere.

The Standard is a trendy, modern hotel in the Meatpacking District with unique architecture, floor-to-ceiling windows, and video art in the elevators. It features a cool bar scene and attracts a fashionable crowd.

The Surrey is described as very elegant, classy, and modern hip, feeling like an actual New York City hotel, and having a classically modern marble lobby with one-of-a-kind art pieces and timeless furniture. The hotel is also described as having undergone upgrades with brand-new decor.

The Sylvan Guest House is located in a historical Harlem neighborhood, close to the Jumel Mansion, and features apartments with African art decor. Some apartments have a deck, modern kitchen, and multiple bedrooms/bathrooms.

The Time Hotel is described as a sophisticated boutique hotel with trendy bars, a happening lounge, modern art deco styling, a funky atmosphere, and colorful, themed rooms (red, blue, yellow).  It is located in the heart of the Theater District, right off Times Square.

The Waldorf Astoria has a beautiful art deco lobby with grand ballrooms, shops and restaurants that give off a classic and luxurious feel. Reviewers note the hotel has friendly service but the rooms can be dated.

The Westin New York at Times Square is a modern hotel with a sleek cocktail bar, contemporary room decor, and an expansive mezzanine-level lobby. Many reviewers enjoyed rooms with modern decor, high-definition televisions, and iPod docking stations.
Hotel Thirty Thirty has a hip, minimalist lobby and sleek accommodations. Some reviewers consider it a trendy and modern hotel.

The Thompson LES is a modern, trendy hotel with sleek and minimalist decor, located in the Lower East Side, known for its hip vibe and proximity to bars, restaurants, and shops. The hotel offers spacious rooms with floor-to-ceiling windows and city views.

The hotel features modern, clean rooms and a pool, but the rooms lack character, and the front desk staff is not consistently friendly. It is near a changing neighborhood with delis and bars, a short walk to the subway, and has easy access to the route home.

The Tribeca Grand is a trendy and modern hotel with a hip vibe, a popular bar/lounge, and stylish decor, attracting a young, fashionable crowd. The hotel has an open atrium, and the bar can be noisy on weekend nights.

The Trump International Hotel & Tower is a modern hotel with immaculate rooms, great views of Central Park, and a prime location near shops and restaurants. The hotel is known for its attentive staff, excellent service, and high-profile clientele.
The Tudor Hotel is described as charming, historic, and recently renovated with a mix of modern and old-world elements. Some reviewers found it quaint and cozy, noting the bar and unique rooms.

The Vincci Avalon, located near the Empire State Building, has a European character in its decoration and service. Some reviewers describe it as updated and updated, while others found it dated with cheap furniture.
W The Court has a trendy bar and a hip atmosphere, with a sleek and modern design in the lobby and rooms. It attracts a young, hip crowd and plays techno music in the lobby and elevators.
The W Tuscany is a trendy and modern hotel with a chic but quiet ambiance. It has a small lobby, rooms with a modern style, and is located next to the W Court.

This trendy and modern hotel is known for its hip atmosphere, sleek design, and lobby bar scene, making it a popular choice for younger travelers. The W Times Square offers a cascading waterfall entrance, rooms with comfortable beds and city views, and is centrally located near Times Square.

The W Union Square is known for its modern and trendy atmosphere, with a hip lobby bar scene and stylish decor; the Underbar is a great place for drinks and fun music. Some reviewers find the hotel dark, with staff that can be pretentious, while others praise the hotel's friendly, casual, and engaging service.

The Waldorf Towers has a rich history, art deco details, and antique furnishings that give it an old-world charm and classic feel, with some rooms offering views of the Chrysler Building. Some reviewers noted that the hotel may not have a modern shine and that some rooms can feel worn.

The Wall Street Inn is a small, quiet, boutique hotel in the heart of the financial district. The hotel has a Euro feel, with stylish rooms, marble bathrooms, and is located on a quaint street near Stone Street eateries.

The Warwick is a historic hotel with a cozy, classic bar featuring leather couches and dark wood, near Central Park and the Theater District. Some rooms have balconies, and the hotel has hosted celebrities like Cary Grant.
The Washington Jefferson Hotel has a marble lobby with a modern look and is decorated to a high standard. It also has a trendy bar and iPod speakers in the room.
The Washington Square Hotel has Art Deco interiors, a cozy bar, and often features jazz music. It is described as having a "cool bohemian vibe," "charm," and a "vintage" feel.

The Wellington Hotel has an art deco lobby that some reviewers find charming; some reviewers also mention that it was used in the movie Borat. Many reviewers describe the hotel as old-fashioned, and not recently renovated.

The West 57th Street by Hilton Club is a new, modern hotel with a contemporary design. Rooms feature hardwood floors, Italian marble showers, and high-tech amenities like flat-screen TVs with extensive cable channels and Yamaha surround sound.
The Wyndham Midtown has a "boutiquey feel" and a bar that is opening in July along with a Creole restaurant. The hotel is located in the Garment District and has a trendy flat screen TV.

The Wolcott Hotel is a historic, old-school hotel with pre-war New York ambiance, located in the heart of Midtown, featuring a beautiful lobby with a grand staircase and marble. While some find it old, noisy and in need of a makeover, others appreciate its character, spacious rooms, and central location near the Empire State Building.

Woogo Central Park Apartments, located at 72nd and Broadway, offers apartment-style accommodations with kitchenettes, providing a feel like a NYC resident rather than a tourist. It is close to the subway and local shops in the Upper West Side.
The Wyndham Garden Hotel boasts a modern and chic design, with new and well-decorated rooms, a stylish lobby, and a rooftop bar. The hotel has a good location close to major attractions.
